intro: Panicularia nervata var. purpurascens, commonly known as the purple-stemmed panicled bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems that turn a distinctive purple hue as the plant matures. The species produces clusters of bell-shaped, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. This plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and wet meadows.
